title: Error "Unable to locate package ros-melodic-ros1-ign" during build of docker image

content.raw:
I just tried to build a new docker image with &~~#34~~;tunnel\_circuit&~~#34~~; as described in Docker install tutorial. The only change is that I used “subt\_tc” instead of “subt” as the docker folder name:

mkdir -p ~/subt\_docker/subt\_tc && cd ~/subt\_docker/subt\_tc  
wget [#!/osrf/subt/raw/tunnel\_circuit/docker/subt\_shell/Dockerfile](#!/osrf/subt/raw/tunnel_circuit/docker/subt_shell/Dockerfile)  
cd ..  
wget [#!/osrf/subt/raw/tunnel\_circuit/docker/build.bash](#!/osrf/subt/raw/tunnel_circuit/docker/build.bash)  
wget [#!/osrf/subt/raw/tunnel\_circuit/docker/run.bash](#!/osrf/subt/raw/tunnel_circuit/docker/run.bash)  
wget [#!/osrf/subt/raw/tunnel\_circuit/docker/join.bash](#!/osrf/subt/raw/tunnel_circuit/docker/join.bash)  
chmod u\+x build.bash run.bash join.bash  
./build.bash subt\_tc

During the build I get the error that package ros-melodic-ros1-ign cannot be located:

Step 14/62 : RUN sudo apt-get install -y ros-melodic-ros1-ign && sudo apt-get clean  
---> Running in 894ea00567dd  
Reading package lists...  
Building dependency tree...  
Reading state information...  
E: Unable to locate package ros-melodic-ros1-ign  
The command &~~#39~~;/bin/sh -c sudo apt-get install -y ros-melodic-ros1-ign && sudo apt-get clean&~~#39~~; returned a non-zero code: 100  
Error response from daemon: No such image: subt\_tc:2019\_Jul\_09\_2016  
Built subt\_tc:2019\_Jul\_09\_2016 and tagged as subt\_tc:latest

What can I do to get the error fixed?  
\(For me it seems to be related to issue ~~#89~~.\)

‌

PS: It is really a hard job to move from gazebo 9 to ignition and docker. We had 3 development computer working with gazebo 9. With docker and ignition two computer do not work at all. It seems to be related with the graphic cards, which do not support CUDA. And with the third computer we also already did some tries with only minor success. That move is really hard and the time goes by …
content.html:
I just tried to build a new docker image with "tunnel_circuit" as described in Docker install tutorial. The only change is that I used “subt_tc” instead of “subt” as the docker folder name:

mkdir -p ~/subt_docker/subt_tc && cd ~/subt_docker/subt_tc
wget #!/osrf/subt/raw/tunnel_circuit/docker/subt_shell/Dockerfile
cd ..
wget #!/osrf/subt/raw/tunnel_circuit/docker/build.bash
wget #!/osrf/subt/raw/tunnel_circuit/docker/run.bash
wget #!/osrf/subt/raw/tunnel_circuit/docker/join.bash
chmod u+x build.bash run.bash join.bash
./build.bash subt_tc

During the build I get the error that package ros-melodic-ros1-ign cannot be located:

Step 14/62 : RUN sudo apt-get install -y ros-melodic-ros1-ign && sudo apt-get clean
---> Running in 894ea00567dd
Reading package lists...
Building dependency tree...
Reading state information...
E: Unable to locate package ros-melodic-ros1-ign
The command '/bin/sh -c sudo apt-get install -y ros-melodic-ros1-ign && sudo apt-get clean' returned a non-zero code: 100
Error response from daemon: No such image: subt_tc:2019_Jul_09_2016
Built subt_tc:2019_Jul_09_2016 and tagged as subt_tc:latest

What can I do to get the error fixed?
(For me it seems to be related to issue #89.)

‌

PS: It is really a hard job to move from gazebo 9 to ignition and docker. We had 3 development computer working with gazebo 9. With docker and ignition two computer do not work at all. It seems to be related with the graphic cards, which do not support CUDA. And with the third computer we also already did some tries with only minor success. That move is really hard and the time goes by …
